|castingnoise=3 |spellnoise=0 }} {{flavour|This spell allows the caster to control their next translocation â€“ either by selecting an approximate target for a teleport, or by selecting a direction for a blink. Be wary that controlled translocations will cause the subject to become contaminated with magical energy, and that controlled teleports will take longer to trigger than uncontrolled ones.}} '''Control Teleport''' is a level 4 [[Charms]]/[[Translocations]] spell which temporarily grants the caster the [[teleport control]] (cTele) [[status effect]]. When [[teleport]]ing with this status, you can choose a specific location, and you will land within 2 tiles of that square (heavily favoring 1 tile away). However, the teleport is delayed by 1d3 turns. When making an uncontrolled [[blink]], you'll be sent 2-7 squares in a direction of your choosing. The status wears off after you make 1 teleport or blink. Be aware that it will cause some [[magic contamination]]. ==History== * This spell was removed in [[0.17]]. * Prior to [[0.13]], the cTele status didn't wear off after a teleport/blink; you could perform multiple controlled teleports with a single cast. Also, controlled teleports didn't delay teleports. [[Category:Obsolete spells]]
